alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Carroll; Emmet; Greene; Humboldt; Kossuth; Palo Alto; Pocahontas; Sac; Webster (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 12 at 3:49AM CST until December 13 at 6:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Freezing Rain Potential Late Tonight into Tuesday Morning... .A large weather system will bring wintry precipitation and increasing winds to the state later today into Tuesday. While there could be drizzle or freezing drizzle this afternoon into early this evening, potential impacts will increase tonight into Tuesday morning. This is when the system will swing a shield of wintry precipitation across Iowa. While much of this will fall as rain, temperatures are forecast at or below freezing over northern into parts of central Iowa tonight into Tuesday morning. This is expected to result in freezing rain and ice accumulation, though rain rates may lessen the accretion. There also remains a fair amount of uncertainty with the temperature forecast and therefore ice accumulations may go up or down as forecasts are updated and trends are monitored over the next 24 hours. Winds will increase through the day today into tonight with the strongest winds on Tuesday and gusts of 40 to 50 mph likely. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch possible. Wind gust in excess of 40 mph are likely. * WHERE...Parts of Northwest Iowa. * WHEN...From late tonight through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, especially for the Tuesday morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
